title: Domain 3.1: Explain basic cable types and their connecotors, features, and purposes.
content:
🧵 3.1 – Network Cables

📡 Coaxial Cable

Used for cable internet, TV, and older networks. Uses an F-type connector.
RG-6 and RG-59 are common variants.

🧠 Tip: If you see "cable modem" or "TV splitter," it's coax.

🛡️ Shielded Twisted Pair (STP)

Twisted pair cable with metal shielding. Reduces EMI.

▪️ Direct Burial: Extra protection for underground use (water-resistant, durable).

🧠 Tip: Use STP/direct burial outdoors or near heavy machinery.

🧵 Unshielded Twisted Pair (UTP)

Most common Ethernet cable. Lighter, cheaper, easier to install.

🧠 Tip: Common in offices, homes, patch cables.

🔥 Plenum-Rated Cable

Special insulation for air ducts and ceilings. Fire-resistant, low smoke.

🧠 Tip: Required by code in HVAC spaces.

💡 Fiber Optic Cable

Sends light instead of electrical signals. High-speed and EMI-immune.

🧠 Tip: Used for long distances, between buildings, or by ISPs.

🔠 T568A / T568B Wiring Standards

RJ-45 pinout wiring standards. A on one end, B on the other = crossover. Same = straight-through.

🎮 Peripheral Cables

🔌 USB 2.0 & 3.0

  • USB 2.0 – 480 Mbps, black tab
  • USB 3.0 – 5 Gbps, blue tab, backward compatible

🔄 Serial

Legacy 9-pin RS-232 ports for config/barcode/POS.

⚡ Thunderbolt

Data + video + power via USB-C. Used in docks, displays, drives.

🖥️ Video Cables

  • HDMI: Audio + video, up to 4K+
  • DisplayPort: High bandwidth, locking latch
  • DVI: Older monitors, no audio
  • VGA: Analog only, fuzzy legacy video

💽 Hard Drive Cables

  • SATA: Internal modern drive cable
  • SCSI: Enterprise/RAID, legacy
  • eSATA: External SATA, not powered
  • IDE: Ribbon-style legacy cable

🔁 Adapters

  • USB-to-Ethernet
  • DVI-to-HDMI
  • Lightning-to-3.5mm
  • DisplayPort-to-VGA

🧠 Tip: Not all adapters convert power/audio.

🔌 Connector Types

  • RJ11 – Phones/modems
  • RJ45 – Ethernet
  • F-Type – Coax
  • ST/SC/LC – Fiber (LC = Little Connector)
  • Punchdown block – Terminating UTP in panels
  • microUSB/miniUSB – Legacy USB
  • USB-C – Reversible, modern standard
  • Molex – Legacy desktop power
  • Lightning – Apple-only
  • DB9 – Serial devices
